page.title: 11EMPLOYMENT IN PADBURY
page.content: There have been vast changes in employment patterns in villages such as Hillesden and Padbury during the last 50 years.Before the Second World War there was a railway station in Padbury,five or six pubs,two bakeries,two general stores,a blacksmith,cobbler,carter, undertaker and joiner and numerous farms requiring much labour.There is now very little employment to be found within the village.Opportunities consist of two shops,a small workshop,a builders yard and some domestic employment for local women.There are some jobs on local farms .In Hillesden the pattern is very similar but the results are more severe.There is now no school,no shop,no pub and only one bus a week. There are very few jobs locally and virtually everybody works elsewhere.
